meta_info.selection_reason: Intense battle at the $417 line as of February 13, 2026 close, with 'sell on news' sentiment after Q4 earnings clashing with bargain hunting.

seo.title: Tesla(TSLA) $417 Defense Battle: Waymo's Counterattack and Insider Selling Truth
seo.meta_description: Tesla stock shaking at $417 in February 2026. Analysis of why shares fell despite Q4 earnings surprise and 110K-share insider selling signal.
seo.author: Financial Hunter-Analyst

hook_summary.heading: 3-Second Investment Key Summary
points: Despite Q4 earnings surprise (EPS $0.50), 'sell on news' volume and intensifying Waymo competition driving weakness.
Recent insider selling of approximately 110K shares detected, weighing on short-term investor sentiment.
Neutral (Hold): $410 support breach is key, stay conservative until $444 (50-day MA) breakout.

content.excerpt: Tesla recorded Q4 earnings surprise yet struggling at $417. Waymo's $16B funding news plus insider selling limiting upside momentum.

sections.heading: Market Overview: Why Shares Are Pressured Despite Strong Earnings
sections.content: Tesla reported Q4 2025 revenue $24.9B, EPS $0.50 beating market expectations. However, profit-taking immediately followed, showing weakness. Waymo's (competitor) massive funding reigniting robotaxi competition fears, suppressing investor sentiment.

sections.heading: Recent Price Trends: $417 Tug-of-War
sections.content: February 13 close at $417.44, remaining below 50-day moving average (~$444), confirming technical weakness. Bounce attempts near $410 short-term support observed, but struggling to digest resistance selling at $430-440 range.

sections.heading: Key Catalysts & Risk Factors: Valuation Burden
sections.content: Tencent cloud contract strengthens China services positively. However, current P/E ratio ~250x carries extreme valuation burden vs. industry average. This makes shares highly sensitive to even minor negative news.

claims.claim: Tencent cloud contract enhancing in-car features

sections.heading: Recent News: Intensifying Competition and Strategic Alliances
sections.content: Waymo accelerating robotaxi commercialization with $16B funding, threatening Tesla's FSD leadership. Meanwhile, Tesla strengthening localization via Tencent partnership for China market defense.

sections.heading: Institutional & Insider Activity: Insider Selling Signal
sections.content: Insiders reported selling ~119K shares recently. Likely profit-taking recognizing share price peak, serving as caution signal for new entrants.

sections.heading: Investment Outlook: Wait for Breakout from Range
sections.bull_case: Strong breakout above $444 (50-day MA) with China sales rebound could re-challenge $500.
sections.bear_case: $410 support breach plus continued robotaxi competition news could see adjustment to $380 range.
sections.strategy: Current levels favor observation over aggressive buying. Recommend entry after confirming $410 support or clear momentum breaking $444.

faq.question: Why is the stock falling despite good Q4 earnings?
faq.answer: Market expectations already priced in, plus Waymo funding news intensified competition fears providing profit-taking rationale.

faq.question: Should I buy Tesla now?
faq.answer: Insider selling and high valuation burden make aggressive buying risky. Confirm $410 support first.
